page.title: 04Landscape.Waterfront.
page.content: The creek is tidal and it forms the estuary of the river Wallington.Now much silted up it was once,in the earlier centuries a seaport in its own right.There are many ancient buildings still standing on the lower quay.The mill is being turned into luxury flats,and the naval hospital,at the time of Napoleon now makes up the office block for a local factory. A marina is situated where once large sailing ships came for repairs and renovation.An annual regatta is held and very well attended.Small ships still use the quay mostly to discharge dredged sand and shingle and in the last century it was a busy coaling jetty.
